data.text:
Diana Rigg

( Actress)

Comments for Diana Rigg

Biography Diana Rigg

Diana Rigg was born in the UK. She made her debut in 1957 in the movie "The Caucasian Chalk Circle". After this film she played a lot of Shakespeare - "Midsummer Night's Dream," "King Lear", "Twelfth Night" and others.

Enormous popularity of the actress brought the film "The Avengers". In 1967 and 1968 she was nominated for an Oscar.

In 1973, Diana Rigg launched its own project on TV - TV series "Diana". For his role in the film "Abelard and Heloise" Rigg received the award Tony.

. In the 1980's Diana Rigg starred in many movies - "Evil Under the Sun", "Big jump Muppet", "Mother Love", "prosecution witness", "Little Mole Rat", "Secret".

. However, in 1990 she returned to the theater stage, where she worked on the most difficult dramatic roles - Cleopatra, Miedeey, Virginia Woolf.

. Actor's work:

. 1

. In the Service of Her Majesty - 1969 (Action)

2. Julius Caesar - 1970 (Drama)

3. Theater of Blood - 1973 (comedy)

4. Evil Under the Sun - 1982 (Thriller)

5. A good man in Africa - 1993 (Tragicomedy)
